text: John Philip Brooke Brooke-Little (6 April 1927â€“13 February 2006) was an officer of arms from England. In 1950 he founded "The Coat of Arms" which is the journal of the Heraldry Society of England. 50 years later, for its Golden Jubilee the society published a collection of essays called Tribute to an ArmoristJohn Campbell-Kease, Ed. Tribute to an Armorist: Essays for John Brooke-Little to Mark the Golden Jubilee of 'The Coat of Arms' . (London: The Heraldry Society, 2000). in his honour. == Heraldic Posts == ===Private=== *Chairman, Heraldry Society 1947-97, *President 1997-2006 ===Official=== *Gold Staff Officer, Coronation 1953 *Bluemantle Pursuivant 1956-67, *Richmond Herald, 1967-80, *Norroy and Ulster King of Arms, 1980-95, *Clarenceux King of Arms, 1995-97 *Registrar, College of Arms 1974-82 *Treasurer, 1978-95 == References == Category:1927 births Category:2006 deaths Category:Heraldry Category:People from London Category:Knights of Justice of the Order of St John
